page.title: 03ST LUKE'S COURT,BOLTON
page.content: St Luke's Court is a home for old people. My mum is the home's warden, in charge of 40 flats. It is her job to look after the health and safety of the people who live there. Every morning,from her office, she speaks to each flat on a central intercom. If she gets no reply, or if told someone is ill, she can go and find out the problem. If someone is ill or injured they can pull a cord in their flat to sound an alarm in the warden's house. The warden goes to the central intercom where a flashing light shows the flats number. She goes to see what is wrong. On the ground floor there is a lounge where they can go for a chat, also there is a kitchen where they can make coffee. There is bingo three times a week and trips are sometimes organised.
